events.originalText: A large explosion of ammonium nitrate stored at the Port of Beirut in Lebanon killed 218 people and caused US$15 billion in damage.
events.subtitle: 2020 Beirut explosion
events.headline: Tragic explosion at Port of Beirut kills 218 in Lebanon

events.originalText: An airport police officer discovered a suitcase containing approximately US$800,000 as it passed through security at Jorge Newbery Airfield in Buenos Aires, sparking an international scandal involving Venezuela and Argentina.
events.subtitle: María del Luján Telpuk
events.headline: Airport officer finds $800,000 suitcase in Buenos Aires

events.originalText: Sri Lankan Civil War: Seventeen employees of the French nongovernmental organization ACF International were massacred in Muttur.
events.subtitle: Sri Lankan Civil War
events.headline: 17 ACF International employees massacred in Sri Lanka

events.originalText: French supercentenarian Jeanne Calment died at the age of 122 years, 164 days, with the longest confirmed human lifespan in history.
events.subtitle: Supercentenarian
events.headline: French supercentenarian Jeanne Calment dies at 122

events.originalText: Yugoslav Wars: The Croatian Army initiated Operation Storm, the last major battle of the Croatian War of Independence and the largest European land battle since the Second World War.
events.subtitle: Yugoslav Wars
events.headline: Croatian Army launches Operation Storm in Yugoslav Wars

events.originalText: Yōhei Kōno, Chief Cabinet Secretary of Japan, issued a formal apology for forcing women into sexual slavery during World War II.
events.subtitle: Yōhei Kōno
events.headline: Japan's Chief Cabinet Secretary apologizes for WWII sexual slavery

events.originalText: An explosion on the Greek cruise ship MTS Oceanos ruptured its hull, causing it to sink off the east coast of South Africa, with all 571 people on board rescued.
events.subtitle: MTS Oceanos
events.headline: Greek cruise ship MTS Oceanos sinks off South Africa

events.originalText: Jean-Baptiste Ouédraogo, the president of Upper Volta, was ousted in a coup d'état led by Thomas Sankara.
events.subtitle: Jean-Baptiste Ouédraogo
events.headline: President of Upper Volta ousted in coup led by Thomas Sankara

events.originalText: President Idi Amin announced the expulsion of Asians from Uganda.
events.subtitle: Idi Amin
events.headline: President Idi Amin expels Asians from Uganda

events.originalText: Vietnam War: The National Security Agency falsely claimed that a U.S. Navy destroyer was attacked a second time by North Vietnamese vessels in the Gulf of Tonkin, leading Congress to authorize the use of military force.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: NSA falsely claims attack in Gulf of Tonkin, leading to military force authorization

events.originalText: World War I: Adhering to the terms of the Treaty of London, the United Kingdom declared war on Germany in response to the latter's invasion of Belgium.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: UK declares war on Germany in response to invasion of Belgium

events.originalText: Lizzie Borden's father and stepmother were found murdered in their home in Fall River, Massachusetts; Borden was later tried and acquitted for the murders.
events.subtitle: Lizzie Borden
events.headline: Lizzie Borden acquitted for murders of father and stepmother

events.originalText: American surveyor James Thompson produced the first plat of Chicago for the Illinois and Michigan Canal Commissioners.
events.subtitle: James Thompson (surveyor)
events.headline: James Thompson produces first plat of Chicago

events.originalText: French Revolutionary Wars: Commanded by Napoleon Bonaparte (depicted), the French Army of Italy decisively defeated Austrian forces led by Peter Vitus von Quosdanovich at the Battle of Lonato.
events.subtitle: French Revolutionary Wars
events.headline: French Army of Italy defeats Austrians at Battle of Lonato

events.originalText: The signing of the Treaty of Sistova brought an end to the Austro-Turkish War.
events.subtitle: Treaty of Sistova
events.headline: Treaty of Sistova ends Austro-Turkish War

events.originalText: Mount Asama in Japan began a climactic eruption, which exacerbated the Great Tenmei famine and led to thousands of deaths.
events.subtitle: Mount Asama
events.headline: Mount Asama eruption worsens Great Tenmei famine in Japan

events.originalText: Mount Asama (pictured) in Japan began a climactic eruption, which exacerbated the Great Tenmei famine and led to thousands of deaths.
events.subtitle: Mount Asama
events.headline: Mount Asama eruption leads to thousands of deaths in Japan

events.originalText: War of the Spanish Succession: A combined Anglo-Dutch fleet under the command of George Rooke and allied with Archduke Charles captured Gibraltar (pictured) from Spain.
events.subtitle: War of the Spanish Succession
events.headline: Anglo-Dutch fleet captures Gibraltar from Spain in War of Spanish Succession

events.originalText: Hundred Years' War: A large-scale mounted raid by Anglo-Gascon forces began under the command of Edward the Black Prince.
events.subtitle: Hundred Years' War
events.headline: Edward the Black Prince leads raid in Hundred Years' War

events.originalText: Second Barons' War: Royal troops led by Prince Edward defeated baronial forces under Simon de Montfort at the Battle of Evesham in Worcestershire, England.
events.subtitle: Second Barons' War
events.headline: Prince Edward defeats baronial forces at Battle of Evesham
